page.title: 09THE CHURCH TODAY
page.content: Rev. Woolven has been vicar of Barling for 12 years. He takes services at Little Wakering and also at Barling Church.On alternate Sundays there are two services or one service at the church. On Sunday morning there are usually thirteen people at a service. On Sunday evening there are twenty five people on average.For special services there may be 60 or seventy people. So far there has been only one marriage this year but Rev. Woolven has married 15 couples since he became vicar.There are usually two or three burials a year and two or three christenings.The Church is cleaned once a week.Mr Edmund plays the organ. There is a women's fellowship which meets on a Tuesday. In the holidays the vicar often runs a club for children.
